office.name: Assistant Secretary of State for Public and Cultural Relations

div.p: The Department of State created the position of Assistant Secretary of State for Public and Cultural Relations during a general reorganization in Dec 1944, after Congress authorized an increase in the number of Assistant Secretaries in the Department from four to six (Dec 8, 1944; P.L. 78-472; 58 Stat. 798). The reorganization was the first to designate substantive designations for specific Assistant Secretary positions. Initially, incumbents supervised the forerunners of the U.S. Information Agency and the Voice of America.
